content.question: The rate of water flow R(t) can be approximated by Q(t) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>79</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>768</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaaWdaeaapeGaaG4naiaaiMdaaaWaaeWa a8aabaWdbiaaiEdacaaI2aGaaGioaiabgUcaRiaaikdacaaIZaGaam iDaiabgkHiTiaadshapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaaaOGaayjk aiaawMcaaaaa@42DA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use Q(t) to approximate the average rate of water flow during the 24-hour period. Indicate units of measure.
